dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3856 IH: Mango Plant Health Initiative Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. González-Colón (for herself and Ms. Tokuda) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to include in the high-priority research and extension initiatives research on mango plant health, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Mango Plant Health Initiative Act.

subsection.text: Section 1672(d) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5925(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Research and extension grants may be made under this section for a term of not less than 5 years for the purposes of—

subparagraph.text: studying potential resistance and tolerance of mangos to native and nonnative disease and insect pests;
conducting research for treatment of pests that affect mangos, including Colletotrichum spp;
conducting field studies to evaluate cultivars of mangos with enhanced resistance to diseases and pests;
disseminating information and educating growers on best practices to promote the safe production of mangos; and
establishing an areawide integrated pest management program in areas affected by, or areas at risk of being affected by, pathogens such as Colletotrichum spp or insect pests, such as thrips.

subsection.text: Section 1672(h) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5925(h)) is amended by striking 2023 and inserting 2028.
